#summary Qutip installation instructions

= Installation on Ubuntu Linux =

 * Requirements. 
{{{
sudo apt-get install python-scipy
sudo apt-get install python-tk
sudo apt-get install python-gtk2
sudo apt-get install python-matplotlib
}}}

 * QuTiP installation
{{{
sudo apt-get install python-setuptools
sudo python setup.py install
}}}

= Installation on Mac OS X =
 ==*Beginner*==
 
*Grab the latest 64-bit Python 2.7.x installer from the Python website:

[http://www.python.org/download]

*After installation, grab the latest Numpy, Scipy, and MatPlotLib Mac packages from:

[http://sourceforge.net/projects/numpy/files/NumPy/]

[http://sourceforge.net/projects/scipy/files/scipy/]

[http://sourceforge.net/projects/matplotlib/files/matplotlib/]

*making sure that they correspond to the Python version listed above (Py27).  This will give you all of the dependencies needed to run QuTiP.

*In order to have GUI elements (optional) such as an About box and progress bar for Monte-Carlo simulations you need to further install the Qt4 and PySide packages at:

[http://qt.nokia.com/downloads/qt-for-open-source-cpp-development-on-mac-os-x]

[http://developer.qt.nokia.com/wiki/PySide_Binaries_MacOSX]

*and also compile (using Xcode) the PyObjc library.  This is readily done using the setuptools easy_install function:

{{{
sudo easy_install pyobjc-core
sudo easy_install pyobjc
}}}
==*Intermediate*==
*Install the Numpy, Scipy ,Matplotlib, Qt4, PySide (or PyQt4), and PyObjc packages via [http://www.macports.org/ MacPorts] or [http://www.finkproject.org/ Fink].

 ==*Advanced*==
*Build the Numpy, Scipy ,Matplotlib, qt4, pyside (or pyQt4), and pyobjc packages yourself!
